ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But when they saw it, they said, 'We must have lost our way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When they saw (and did not recognise it) they said: "Surely we have lost the way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But as soon as they beheld the orchard, (they cried out): “We have certainly lost the way;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When they saw the garden, they said, "Surely we have lost our way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then when they saw it, they said, “We have indeed strayed.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But when they saw it, they said: "Verily, we have gone astray."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But when they saw it, they said: Most surely we have gone astray
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: But when they saw it, they said, 'Surely we are gone astray;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But when they saw it, they said: Lo! we are in error!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But when they saw it, they said, "We must have lost our way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then when they beheld it, they said: verily we have strayed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But when they saw it, they said, ‘We have indeed lost our way!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But when they saw the (garden), they said: "We have surely lost our way:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But when they saw the (garden), they said: "Verily, we have gone astray,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But when they saw it they said: 'We have surely gone astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But when they saw it, they said, “We were wrong.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:26] But when they saw it, blackened and charred, they said, ‘Assuredly we have strayed!’, from it, that is to say: this is not the one. Then when they recognised it, they said:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But when they saw it) when they saw the fields burned down, (they said: Lo! we are in error!) we have taken a wrong turn; thinking that they were not their fields
